item.title: use sudo with no password
item.description: In Unix world, we shouldn’t use administrator user without some important stuff which needs access to it. There is a utility sudo we can use to have administrator access. But everytime you invoke it, it asks for your user’s password. Today, I’m going to guide you, how you can use sudowithout password. Once you install Debian, you get some option to create a user. And if you choose the option, “Don’t use root for login”, this new user becomes privileged user by default.
